author: wsjcom
title: ‘The Shadow Emperor’ Review: The Other Bonaparte
text:
It began with a coup d’etat and collapsed in military defeat in an unnecessary war. The Second (Bonapartist) Empire lasted longer than the first, 18 years as against 10, but left no sunset memory of “la gloire.” The exiled Victor Hugo dismissed its emperor, Louis Napoleon, as “Napoleon le Petit.” Bismarck called him “a sphinx without a riddle.”
Louis Napoleon’s story is certainly remarkable. Alan Strauss-Schom tells it with brio in “The Shadow Emperor.” He makes a good case—perhaps the best possible case—for an enigmatic figure...
